page.title: 05HUNT BROTHERS FOUNDRY
page.content: Hunt Brothers was established in Oldbury over 100 years ago and employs 150 people. The foundry is involved in the latest developments of casting technology, producing all metal products such as counter weights for fork lift trucks and even train engines. The metals used include grey iron, alloy nickel, chrome and haematite. These have a weight range from a few pounds to 50 tons. The scrap iron is melted down to a liquid and poured into moulds. When the liquid is poured into the casting it has a temperature of between 1300 and 1400 degrees. Moulds and cores are made using air setting sand systems. 250 tons of sand are used each week to produce castings from old or existing patterns. The pattern workshop is capable of producing all patterns needed in wood.
